alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:11AM EST until December 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Hunterdon and Warren. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 909 AM EST, flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Musconetcong River at Bloomsbury: At 9:00am the stage was 6.04 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. ... For South Branch Raritan River at High Bridge: At 8:45am the stage was 10.22 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. ... For Spruce Run at Clinton: At 8:15am the stage was 4.22 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. ... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
